results.title: Cool Cats: 25 Years of Rock `N` Roll
results.brief_description: Cool Cats traces the evolution of rock-related style, fashion and affectation; from stovepipe trousers, drape jackets and duck’s tail haircuts to bondage straps, androgynous jumpsuits and lethal Mohican scalp spikes. The performances and posturing of the Rolling Stones, Little Richard, Tina Turner, The Beatles, among others, are intertwined with observations from the likes of Pete Townshend, Phil Everly, Malcolm McLaren and Grace Slick. Rating: G

results.title: Cooks in clover
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Gas Council and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Traces the regional origins of traditional British food, and shows how anyone interested in cooking can recreate the sumptuous fare of the past by the use of modern techniques in cooking. Demonstrates how to obtain perfect results when preparing Dover Sole, Melton Mowbray Pork Pie and the Roast Beef of Old England with comparative ease.

results.title: Cooking in liquids
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Gas Council and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Of interest to anyone who likes to cook, particularly beginners. This film shows the right temperature for boiling; a time-saving stew needing no preliminary frying; spaghetti hints; a marinade for tenderising; finally, an invitation to be experimental in the kitchen.

results.title: Cookie goes to hospital
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
The kids of DeGrassi Street find themselves involved in another adventure when Cookie suddenly takes ill during a club meeting and is sent to hospital to have her appendix removed. Cookie is apprehensive of her first visit to hospital and asks her friends to get her doll from the club house. Provides an insight into hospital routines and operational procedures.

results.title: Cook's First Journey
results.brief_description:
This film depicts Captain Cook sailing and discovering new lands, meeting the natives and subsequently returning home.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Richard Mudford
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Conversation
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Centron Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Demonstrates and explains how conversation (informal speech) reaches into every phase of our everyday life; that is our surest way of making or losing friends, of being hired or fired. Through dramatic incidents, the film illustrates some important do’s and don’ts in social and business conversation, and indicates effective speech techniques to use.
